results.title: California fire disaster 1970
results.brief_description: Fire service experts discuss the causes, problems and results of the extensive fires occurring in California in 1970. In news documentary format they cover various aspects of preventing and fighting large scale fires. In news documentary format.
results.description: Fire service experts discuss the causes, problems and results of the extensive fires occurring in California in 1970. In news documentary format they cover various aspects of preventing and fighting large scale fires. In news documentary format.

results.title: Cadet worlds: Portugal, 1974
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Two helmsmen from Tasmania were selected to represent Australia in the 1974 ‘cadet’ Dinghy World Championships. Beginning with the Tasmanian crews mid-winter training at the Sandy Bay Sailing Club in Hobart, the action culminates in the competitions sailed in Portugal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Anderson and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production

results.title: Cadet Rousselle
results.creator_credit: George Dunning, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Animated puppets illustrate the old French satirical song about Cadet Rousselle, ostentatious, affected, the clown of the period between the French Revolution and the military order of Napoleon. Cadet Rousselle falls down a ladder, trips on battlements, even his dogs will not obey him. Animation: George Dunning, Colin Low Award: Gardone

results.title: Le Cadeau
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a little man after many unsuccessful attempts manages to make a trumpet emit the appropriate sound. This film won first prize for animation at the Westdeutsche Kurzfilmtage and first prize at Cork International Film Festival. Animation by Michel Altermatt and Rene Guillaume. No narration, music only.

results.title: The Cactus: profile of a plant
results.creator_credit: Edward C. Harris and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Examines the structure life functions of the cactus in its natural environment by means of close-up time lapse photography. Explains the ability of the cactus to survive in the harsh desert environment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward C. Harris and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Cabbage root fly
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the life cycle of this insect which has become a serious pest in Europe and America, the larvae attacking cruciferous plants such as the cabbage and cauliflower.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit

results.title: The Cabbage butterfly
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the cabbage butterfly is shown. The adult lays the eggs on the underside of the cabbage leaf, the eggs hatch and progress through five larval stages. Time-lapse photography follows the emergence of the butterfly from the chrysalis. Suggests methods of keeping the various stages in observance jars. English commentary, captions in Japanese. Credits in Japanese.
results.description: The life cycle of the cabbage butterfly is shown. The adult lays the eggs on the underside of the cabbage leaf, the eggs hatch and progress through five larval stages. Time-lapse photography follows the emergence of the butterfly from the chrysalis. Suggests methods of keeping the various stages in observance jars. English commentary, captions in Japanese. Credits in Japanese.

results.title: The Byzantine Empire [B&W]
results.brief_description: The Byzantine Empire had become, by 750 AD, the richest and most powerful in the world. This film presents a brief historical outline of the Empire, and indicates its important cultural contributions in art, religion and scholarship. Photographed principally in Greece and Turkey, the film captures the richness of the mosaic works, icons and architecture. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: By the seat of our pants
results.creator_credit: Peter Monger, Julie Cutler, Peter Norton, Social Welfare Dept of Victoria and Task Force
results.brief_description: A film about the problems of unemployment. Interspersed with comments from sympathetic as well as unsympathetic ‘experts’, four young people living in Prahran tell their stories of largely unfortunate experiences with employers and government institutions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Monger, Julie Cutler, Peter Norton, Social Welfare Dept of Victoria and Task Force
